citeinfo.origin: Minnesota Department of Transportation, Office of Land Management
citeinfo.title: Railroad Valuation Map Footprints, Minnesota

descript.abstract: This dataset is a polygon shapefile of the spatial extents of rectified railroad valuation map images. The image corresponding to each of the map footprints contains information about the railroad ownership, the map roll number, sheet numbers and file name of the image.
descript.purpose: Image footprints were created to facilitate map access and file management through use of a spatial index retrieval system.

timeperd.current: The time period of the source data ranges between 1918 and 1974. The Minnesota Department of Transportation received the data from the Railroad and Warehouse Commission in 1974.

theme.themekey: Transportation, Valuation Images, Right of Way maps, ROW, railroads, railroad junctions, Statewide_RR_FP (Feature Class Name)

citeinfo.title: Railroad coverage including abandoned lines, Railroad Station Plat images, Railroad Valuation images, Railroad Right of Way map, State basemap (active railroad lines), 1936 County Map Series with Government Lots, Sections, Townships and Ranges, other Minnesota Railroad and Warehouse Commission Historical Railroad documents.

cntperp.cntorg: MN Department of Transportation, Office of Land Management

attracc.attraccr: An extensive quality assurance/quality control process was applied to assure that the correct attributes were linked to the correct arc/footprint and that the attribute naming was correct.

dataqual.logic: Data are topologically correct. All polygons close.
dataqual.complete: There is a polygon representing each Valuation image associated with all rail lines. Each Valuation Map Image was captured to the edge of the blueprint itself in order that everything on the image might be included.

horizpa.horizpar: The shapefile accurately represents the valuation images. However, the valuation images, generally accurate to within 15 meters, may be as much as 60 meters off in some areas.

procstep.procdesc: The footprint shapefile was created under contract with St. Cloud State University, Spatial Analysis Center, by outlining the rectified Valuation Images. Each polygon was labeled with the name of the corresponding image it represents. For this project the Valuation maps were scanned wherever possible. If a Valuation map was not available for a particular area, but there was a Railroad Right of Way map, the Railroad Right of Way map was scanned. The Railroad Right of Way maps have the following data relative to the railroad right of way: land lines (e.g. section lines, quarter lines and sixteenth lines), centerline alignment including curve data used to define the right of way, land ties (e.g. distances and angles between the centerline and land lines) and the right of way width. The valuation maps contain the same data as the Railroad Right of Way maps plus data relative to the acquisition of the railroad right of way. This acquisition data includes: the grantor, grantee, type of acquisition (e.g. warranty deed, quit claim deed, easement, land grant, etc.), date of acquisition, purchase price and book and page where acquisition documents are recorded. Some of MnDOT's Railroad Right of Way and Station Plat maps can be considered 'Track Maps'. While few in number, these Track Maps show the layout and detail of track structures, especially where there are multiple track.

overview.eaover:
Railroad Valuation Map - Raster Image File Footprints data set contain the following attribute data fields:
OBJECTID - data system file number, polygon identifier Shape - the geometric shape of the footprint Id - ROLL_NUMBE - the roll number of the map SHEET_NUMB - the sheet number. Map rolls can be split into several sheets. FILE_NAME - the image file name with file extension RR_NAME - the railroad name RR_ABBR - the railroad name abbreviation COUNTY_NAM - the county name IMAGE_PATH - the image file path name COUNTY_STR - the MnDOT county number. Zero filled for single digits. COUNTY_NUM - the MnDOT county number Shape_Leng - the length of the footprint Shape_Area - the area of the footprint

stdorder.ordering:
Download the footprints shapefile via the Minnesota Geospatial Commons (click "I AGREE" in the Online Linkage field below). The footprints shapefile transfer size is 950kb.
All map image files can be downloaded directly from RIGHT OF WAY MAPPING AND MONITORING or ELECTRONIC DOCUMENT ACCESS. See this CHART for a comparison between these delivery sites. For other information or assistance, complete the on-line request FORM by including your contact information and telephone number or send the same information to lisrwmap.dot@state.mn.us
RIGHT OF WAY MAPPING AND MONITORING - http://www.dot.state.mn.us/maps/gisweb/row/ ELECTRONIC DOCUMENT ACCESS - Currently available only when using Internet Explorer. http://dotapp7.dot.state.mn.us/cyberdocs_guest/Libraries/Default_Library/Groups/GUESTS/frameset.asp CHART - http://gisservices.dot.state.mn.us/mndot-rwmm/Right%20of%20Way%20Mapping.docx FORM - http://olmwebservices.dot.state.mn.us/maprequest/requestmain.aspx
